features: [ Alycolic Acid 7% Toner] Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Resurfacing Solution blemishes and acne, Say goodbye to enlarged pores! Glycolic acid ToningSolution helps to minimize the appearance of pores, giving your skin a smoother and more refined texture.

(Natural ingredients): This product is our newly researched glycolic acid 7% toner. This product has added: 7% glycolic acid, aloe vera, ginseng extract, vitamin B5, and other plant extracts. Improves the stratum corneum of the pores and makes the skin more delicate smooth young
[ Clears acne] Moisturize and strengthen the skin barrier, improve blemishes and acne, astringe pores, and gently remove cutin.
[Brighten skin] color This treatment gently resurfaces the skin to promote! a bright, even tone and a smooth, soft texture.
[SUITABLE SKIN TYPE] Dry skin, oily skin, mixed skin, and mature skin.Not applicable to sensitive, peeling, or damaged skin.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 240ml Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Toner, Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Resurfacing Solution, Facial Exfoliation Astringe Pores, Hydrates and Reduces Skin Blemishes

240ml Glycolic Acid 7% Toner After cleansing, take an appropriate amount of toner on a cotton pad, wipe off acne and large pores on the face, and clean the residue on the skin surface (or pour it into your hands and pat it on the face until absorbed). No need to wash after use, follow up with moisturizing work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I think it works great
reviews.reviewText: I'm not familiar with the product that this is supposed to be a dupe of, but I used it in place of my normal toner and I have to say that I really liked it. It made my face feel soft and clean after washing with my regular cleanser. I'm at the age where I, unfortunately, have to be worried about anti-aging serums, <sad face> but compared to others I've tried, this one ranks right up there with the top choices I've tried. There is really no scent, which is great for me because I'm sensitive to that. I also consider myself to have sensitive skin and I had no reactions after using this. My face was not itchy at all and usually I find toner to be kind of drying, which was not the case with this one. I was impressed at the size of the bottle too. This will last me a really long time because you don't need much and bottle is really large. I am using it cautiously, as the bottle mentions, to build up my skin's tolerance to it. So far it's just a few times a week until I get used to using it and make sure I don't have a reaction to it. So far, so good. I will most likely keep using this in my skincare routine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars It's not The Ordinary brand
reviews.reviewText: 240ml Glycolic Acid 7% Toner, Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Resurfacing SolutionI, too, got this item thinking it was The Ordinary brand - and their well-respected, high-quality face products.Instead, this is a knock-off. And I'd be OK with that, except at this point I don't trust that any of ingredients are what are listed on the box or the label. And there's no country of origin - which is suspect. Quality skincare will list that.Having said that - I put this on my legs and experienced no breakouts. And a decent amount of moisturizing. But I can't recommend it because I trust that it is what it says it is - as they're clearly trying to borrow the reputation from a well known brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not the Ordinary
reviews.reviewText: I have a bottle of Ordinary so I was able to compare side by side. I don’t know why this company was dishonest about this product being the Ordinary and once that happens they’ve lost their credibility. Even though the product feels good and has no scent just like the Ordinary and seems almost identical, I really don’t know why they weren’t honest about this being a dupe of a popular product. I think if they included an ingredient list and was forthcoming and priced right, people will be willing to purchase but this isn’t right.Update: I had received kojic acid powder that I wanted to test so I added it to this bottle of what I believe is glycolic acid and it mixed in very well and the product worked really well. My skin looks improved and brighter so I am adding some stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This review is for: 240ml Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Toner, Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Resurfacing Solution, Facial Exfoliation Astringe Pores, Hydrates and Reduces Skin BlemishesWhen ordering this toner, I read the title as it being The Ordinary (brand), since the packing is identical, the word ordinary was in the title, and the Glycolic percentages and PH were similar. I was rather surprised to receive this however. Regardless, I tried looking for where the product was manufactured but couldn't find this info on the package or the product listing page. I also looked up the ingredients list but it isn't listed on the product or the listing page (general category of what's in the product is listed but not the complete ingredients list). So it's fair to assume, I will not be trying this on my face for safety reasons. I ended up giving this two-stars because it may very well be a decent product but it would be nice to see the ingredients list and country of manufacturing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's A Dupe
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this thinking it was The Ordinary brand, and it is not. Why did I think this, you ask? Because it literally SAYS SO in the product description, and it looks exactly like it, and is priced exactly the same. I'm a fan of The Ordinary and would not have ordered this had I been more careful and realized it's not legit. If it was a quality dupe at a better price, sure, I'm always happy to save money. But this offers no additional benefit to make it worthwhile. I checked the ingredients list and they are nearly identical (but listed in different order, so not sure if it's a different formulation.) Overall, I'm annoyed that I was fooled into ordering something that is not what it seems. I've used it and, so far, it's just fine, which is why I'm giving it 4 stars. If they didn't try to pass it off as a name brand, I would probably have given it 5 stars, but I think this is shady and I'll be careful to order the real thing next time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I am all for a good dupe but this is not it. Aside from the fact that the words are misspelled, e.,g., Clinical is spelled "linical", there is no formal listing of ingredients as one would expect but just a product composition sidebar with a few pictures. No where on the box, product, or page listing does it indicate the place of manufacture or lot/batch numbers. There is no brand associated and looks like it was a school made prototype. The price of this is even higher than the real one!! Because there are too many unknowns and safety concerns, I chose not to use this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Identical ingredients to name brand
reviews.reviewText: While this is not the original from The Ordinary, it does have the same listed ingredients and works well in my opinion. I use this both on my face as a toner and on my arms to help with uneven skin texture.Review of: 240ml Glycolic Acid 7% Toner, Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Resurfacing Solution, Facial Exfoliation Astringe Pores, Hydrates and Reduces Skin Blemishes

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A dupe of an already affordable product
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this toner thinking I was ordering The Ordinary glycolic acid toning solution, but no, it's a copycat of that, all the way down to the appearance of the packaging. This doesn't bother me, because who doesn't love a quality skin care dupe, but the original product is already very reasonably priced. I found this toner to be silky, effective, and non-irritating, so to me it is a very good product. The only thing that I found deficient is that I could not find a comprehensive ingredient list on either the bottle or the packaging. The "product composition" lists key ingredients, but I would like to see the full set of ingredients.
